channel.title: Course Overview on Data Science for Biotechnology
channel.description: Recent content in Course Overview on Data Science for Biotechnology

item.title: Cool Companies
item.description: Cool & Relevant Companies NOTE: we are not sponsoring these companies in any way, shape, or form. This is just to help and hopefully inspire people to dip their toe into the field. Illumina Benevolent AI Novo Nordisk Corti AI Reverie Labs Buoy Health Siligon Therapeutics

item.title: Datasets
item.description: Datasets Healthcare / Medicine / Biotech Realm Pfizer Vaccine Tweets COVID-19 Open Research Dataset Challenge (CORD-19) Novel Corona Virus 2019 Dataset Heart Disease UCI Chest X-Ray Images (Pneumonia) NeurIPS 2020: Data Science for COVID-19 (DS4C) Miscellaneous Datasets that you can load with Python 1.88 million US Wildfires Spotify Dataset 1921-2020, 160k+ Tracks 120 years of Olympic History: Athletes and Results Interesting Data to Visualize Plotly Datasets (CSV)

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Required: Create a Github account and email us your username (we will add you to our DS4B organization on GitHub) Once you are added to the GitHub DS4B organization, create a new repository (within the organization) for your DS4B coursework. Name it <first name>-<last name>. Click the “Add a README file” button when initializing the repo. Make the repository private. Clone the repository on your local machine.

item.title: Week 1
item.description: Week 1: Introduction to the Course Links Data Science vs. Computer Science Jamboard Biotechnology Jamboard Jupyter Notebook Setup Creating a GitHub Repository Kaggle Datasets Creating a Simple Linear Regression using sklearn Jupyter Notebook Installation OPTION 1: Anaconda > Jupyter Notebooks $ conda install -c conda-forge notebook OPTION 2: If you already have Python installed, you can use a software management tool called pip. $ pip3 install jupyter OR
